entry.headline: U.S. Bank and AeroMexico Give Travelers a New Way to Earn Rewards with the AeroMexico Visa and AeroMexico Visa Signature Cards
entry.body: MINNEAPOLIS--(Business Wire)-- U.S. residents who visit Mexico can earn travel rewards simply by using the new AeroMexico Visa or AeroMexico Visa Signature Card for their purchases. U.S. Bank and AeroMexico now offer customers the opportunity to earn AeroMexico Club Premier Miles for all their purchases. Miles can be redeemed for travel from 16 U.S. airports served by AeroMexico to more than 40 destinations in Mexico as well as other popular international destinations, including Buenos Aires, Madrid, Paris, Rome, Tokyo, Sao Paulo and Shanghai, in the airline`s global flight network. Additionally, AeroMexico`s participation in the SkyTeam global airline alliance facilitates travel to hundreds of other destinations around the world. "The AeroMexico Visa Card offers valuable travel reward opportunities for U.S. residents and business travelers who make frequent trips to Mexico and beyond," said Pat Coll, executive vice president of U.S. Bank Retail Payment Solutions. "With U.S. Bank`s experience as a leading credit card issuer and AeroMexico`s status as the largest airline in Mexico, this partnership is an ideal match. The new AeroMexico Visa Card brings the airline`s mileage rewards program to a new U.S.-based audience with significant growth opportunities in key markets." Frank Galan, vice president, U.S. Operations, AeroMexico, said, "The new AeroMexico Visa and AeroMexico Visa Signature Cards are outstanding additions to the many benefits our passengers enjoy with our premier style of service. Our customers in the United States who use these cards will receive new travel rewards every time they shop or fly with AeroMexico to any of our more than 65 international destinations in Mexico and around the world." "AeroMexico Visa and AeroMexico Visa Signature Card holders will also automatically become members of Club Premier, AeroMexico`s frequent flyer program, which gives them access to other travel benefits like free upgrades and use of our airport lounges. Both business and leisure travelers will enjoy the many advantages they`ll receive through this complementary program," added Galan. New AeroMexico Visa cardholders can get on the fast track to award travel with up to 20,000 bonus miles (for AeroMexico Visa Signature cardholders) and a Complimentary Companion Ticket upon enrollment as well as discounted Web airfare purchases and double miles on AeroMexico ticket purchases using the card. For more information or to apply for the AeroMexico Visa Card, please visit www.aeromexico.com and go to the special AeroMexico Visa Card section on the airline`s home page. U.S. Bank has issued consumer and corporate cards for decades and has long supported the airline industry, largely through its partnership with frequent flyer programs. The company also provides card processing services for more than 80 airlines globally through its Elavon subsidiary. In addition, U.S. Bank supports corporate and private aircraft fleets through the U.S. Bank Multi Service Aviation Card, accepted worldwide by more than 7,000 aviation service providers in over 190 countries. AeroMexico operates the largest frequent flyer program among airlines in Mexico with more than two million Club Premier members, who are located around the world, and the most extensive range of benefits available. Club Premier membership benefits include bonus miles, free upgrades, free access to Salon Premier lounges in major airports around the world and exclusive promotions. AeroMexico and its subsidiary, AeroMexico Connect, currently operate more than 600 daily flights between 16 cities in the United States and more than 40 destinations in Mexico, including its hub operations at Mexico City International Airport; as well as connecting service to international destinations, including Tokyo, Paris and Buenos Aires, in 12 other countries around the world. U.S. cities served currently are Los Angeles, Ontario (Ca.), San Diego, San Francisco, Seattle-Tacoma, Las Vegas, Phoenix, Albuquerque, Denver, San Antonio, Houston, Chicago, Atlanta, New York City, Orlando and Miami. The airline`s first Canadian service began March 3 in Toronto and service to Montreal will begin April 2. AeroMexico Vacations provides customized vacation travel packages throughout this network. The airline also offers additional international service through its SkyTeam global airline alliance with 11 full member carriers and three associate carriers. AeroMexico has been recognized internationally for its award-winning style of personalized in-flight service, one of the world's best on-time flight records, the highest safety and quality standards ratings, outstanding reliability and baggage handling performance, and exceptional value based on its competitive fares and superior service. Additional information is available at www.aeromexico.com or 1-800-237-6639. U.S. Bancorp (NYSE: USB), with $266 billion in assets, is the parent company of U.S. Bank, the 6th largest commercial bank in the United States. The company operates 2,791 banking offices and 5,164 ATMs, and provides a comprehensive line of banking, brokerage, insurance, investment, mortgage, trust and payment services products to consumers, businesses and institutions. Visit U.S. Bancorp on the web at www.usbank.com. U.S. Bank Teri Charest, 612-303-0732 teri.charest@usbank.com OR Nancy Del Regno, 214-206-5629 (c); 214-932-6102 (o) nancy.delregno@levensonbrinkerpr.com Copyright Business Wire 2009

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Pfizer plans 4-part bond to finance Wyeth buy-lead
entry.body:
LONDON, March 16 (Reuters) - Pfizer Inc (PFE.N), the world's largest drugmaker, is planning a four-part benchmark bond denominated in U.S. dollars to help fund its purchase of Wyeth WYE.N, one of the banks managing the sale said on Monday.

The deal will consist of three-year, six-year, 10-year and 30-year bonds, the bank said.

Bank of America/Merrill Lynch, Barclays Capital, Citigroup, Goldman Sachs and JP Morgan are joint bookrunners, the bank said.

(Reporting by Natalie Harrison)

entry.headline: Azaleos and M3 Technology Group Merger Creates Dominant Market Leader for Remotely Managed Microsoft Exchange Services
entry.body: Combined Companies Have Staff and East/West Coast Operations Centers to Support Largest Customers; Unveil New Managed Active Directory Service SEATTLE & CHARLOTTE, N.C.--(Business Wire)-- Azaleos® Corporation, the managed Microsoft Exchange services company, and M3 Technology Group (M3TG) today announced they have merged their businesses to become the market`s leading provider of remotely managed Microsoft Exchange and related services. The combined companies, which will operate under the Azaleos brand, now have the technical support resources as well as East and West coast network operations centers necessary to support even the largest organizations. The new company`s customers include Chiquita, Alcon, Wendy`s/Arby`s, and Extended Stay. Azaleos also announced the immediate availability of ADXchange, a new monitoring and management service for Active Directory. Leading research firms estimate the worldwide remote infrastructure services market at $20 billion at the close of 2008, and forecast it could grow to approximately $40 billion by the end of 2012. Additionally, they estimate that by 2012, 70% of all North American companies will have remote infrastructure service contracts. The new company, which will be headed by the current Azaleos management team and retain most of the service, support, and professional services employees from both organizations, has the highest concentration of Exchange and Unified Communications expertise outside of Microsoft. Customers will now be supported by two network operations centers in the United States, one in Seattle and one in Charlotte. The combined companies will also continue to work with their existing reseller partners led by IBM Professional Services. "The merger of Azaleos and M3 Technology Group is a seamless technology and business marriage for both companies that establishes us as the clear market leader in the managed Exchange market," said Phil Van Etten, Chief Executive Officer of Azaleos. "Together we have the size, scale, and bi-coastal operations to service organizations from the mid-market all the way up to the largest enterprises." "As soon as we began our initial business conversations, we knew this was a natural fit for both companies," said Tony Prince, CEO and president of M3 Technology Group. "The combined companies have the resources, expertise, and skilled personnel to capitalize on the very large market opportunity that exists for an on-premise and remotely managed alternative to hosted Exchange e-mail services." ADXchange - Remotely Managed Active Directory Companies depend on Active Directory (AD) as their primary tool to manage the identities and relationships that make up network environments. Its proper functioning is critical to the network and the many applications, such as Exchange, relying on it. The first immediate by-product of the Azaleos and M3TG merger is a new remotely managed service for on-premise Active Directory called ADXchange. AD administration, including directory consolidation, identity management and DNS configuration, is a manual, time consuming, and ongoing process. With ADXchange, an organization`s Active Directory infrastructure is managed remotely by experts in the Azaleos network operations center. To prevent downtime and free up internal IT resources for line of business technology initiatives ADXchange provides continuous monitoring, management, and patching of Active Directory. Most Comprehensive Suite of Managed Exchange Services The combination of Azaleos and M3TG enables organizations to source from one supplier the most complete and reliable set of remotely managed services for Exchange, Blackberry Enterprise Server, and now also Active Directory. These include: * ViewXchange, real-time monitoring and reporting for Exchange and its associated IT infrastructure * ManageXchange, 24X7 remote command and control for on-premise Exchange environments * MobileXchange, turnkey management and monitoring for the Blackberry Enterprise Server * ProtectXchange, cloud-based anti-virus/anti-spam service * RestoreXchange, dual-site disaster recovery for both dial tone and mail storage restoration * ArchiveXchange, automatic e-mail archiving and storage for Exchange server Availability The Azaleos ADXchange service is available immediately from Azaleos and its business partners. All Azaleos services can be purchased with All-In-One financing options that wrap hardware, Azaleos OneStop managed services, and any deployment and migration services into a single monthly subscription. Financing packages are available from ePlus, NetApp and Microsoft Financing. Customers who choose the Microsoft program are also eligible for a special "no payments for 6 months" offer available through June 30, 2009. About Azaleos Azaleos Corporation provides 24/7 remotely managed messaging and Active Directory services for enterprises with on-premise installations of Microsoft Exchange Server and Blackberry Enterprise Server. Azaleos OneServer and OneStop Services offer remote monitoring, management, maintenance, and reporting, which enable an organization`s IT staff to focus on strategic technology initiatives. Azaleos solutions can be installed and up and running in less than one day. A Microsoft Gold Certified partner, Azaleos was founded in 2004 and is led by senior executives from Microsoft, IBM, and Lotus. For more information visit www.azaleos.com. About M3 Technology Group M3TG helps customers gain a competitive advantage by designing, deploying and managing reliable email and directory solutions. Our unique Managed Messaging solution provides 24x7x365 monitoring, reporting, support, and expert analysis for on-premise email, archival and directory systems. Organizations across four continents leverage M3TG`s expertise to implement a proactive approach for managing key messaging, archival and directory platforms. For more information on M3TG, visit www.M3TG.com. The names of companies and products mentioned herein may be the trademarks of their respective owners. Marc Gendron PR Marc Gendron, 781-237-0341 marc@mgpr.net Copyright Business Wire 2009

entry.headline: Rivet Software Joins IBM's Software as a Service Specialty
entry.body: DENVER, CO, Mar 16 (MARKET WIRE) -- Rivet(R) Software today announced it has joined the IBM (NYSE: IBM) Software as a Service (SaaS) Specialty to deliver XBRL creation, viewing and analysis solutions to U.S. public companies that are required to submit financial information in eXtensible Business Reporting Language (XBRL) format under the recently adopted mandate by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission. The SaaS model appeals to finance and accounting users because of its convenience, rapid deployment and minimal need for investment. By leveraging this increasingly popular enterprise model, Rivet is able to provide services to its clients from a secure, scalable and highly available environment through IBM's Managed Hosting services delivered on IBM System x servers. "SaaS is one of the fastest growing segments of the IT industry because it provides companies of all sizes with access to innovative solutions delivered remotely via a subscription model," said Dave Mitchell, director of strategy, IBM Developer Relations. "Rivet's commitment to SaaS can provide its customers with a powerful way to reduce implementation costs while rapidly deploying business applications." IBM offers hardware, software and infrastructure technologies to help its Business Partners, such as Rivet Software, deliver secure and scalable services. This teaming will enable Rivet Software to design, build, deliver and market SaaS solutions to help their clients implement software solutions that will make it easier to manage reporting of financial information in XBRL format. "We are pleased that IBM has accepted our company into its SaaS Specialty," said Michael Rohan, founder and president, Rivet Software. "The speed of change in organizations, such as the need to respond to the global adoption of XBRL, requires agile solutions that can be deployed as quickly and simply as possible without compromising security and reliability." The IBM SaaS Specialty partner program provides valuable benefits, resources, technical enablement and marketing support. In addition, Business Partners gain access to IBM Innovation Centers, providing them with technical support and expertise for helping them test, build and optimize cloud services based on open platforms. For more information on the IBM SaaS Specialty partner program, visit: www.ibm.com/partnerworld/saas. About Rivet Software: Rivet develops innovative, easy-to-use Financial Communications and Analysis software, including XBRL creation and viewing applications, and Crossfire(R) Analyst, a web-based financial aggregation, analysis and publishing solution designed for accounting, finance and other business users. Rivet Software, based in Denver, Colorado, supports its products with training, user assistance and consulting services. Rivet has provided software and assistance to over half of the filers in the SEC Voluntary Filing Program. For additional information, please visit www.rivetsoftware.com. Copyright 2009 Rivet Software, Inc. All rights reserved. Rivet, Crossfire, CrossTag, DragonTag and DragonView are either registered trademarks or trademarks of Rivet Software, Inc. in the United States and other countries. XBRL is a registered trademark of XBRL International, Inc. All other trademarks are the property of their respective owners. Copyright 2009, Market Wire, All rights reserved. -0-

entry.headline: The Radicati Group Releases "Microsoft Exchange Server and Outlook Market Analysis, 2009-2013"
entry.body: PALO ALTO, CA, Mar 16 (MARKET WIRE) -- The Radicati Group, Inc.'s latest study, "Microsoft Exchange Server and Outlook Market Analysis, 2009-2013," provides an in-depth analysis of the market for Microsoft Exchange Server and Microsoft Outlook, including market share, installed base by version, as well as breakouts by business size, and region. According to the report, Microsoft Exchange Server will have a total installed base of 241 million on-premises and hosted mailboxes by year-end 2009, and is expected to grow to a total of 347 million by 2013. This represents an average annual growth rate of 11%. The report provides extensive breakout information for Microsoft Exchange Server penetration by version, business size and region in North America, EMEA, Asia/Pacific, and Rest of World. In addition, it also provides installed base and breakout information for Microsoft Outlook, including Outlook Web Access (OWA), and Hosted Microsoft Exchange Server. Microsoft's recently released Business Productivity Online Suite (BPOS) is also analyzed, and strengths and weaknesses are discussed for all current Microsoft Messaging and Collaboration products. To order a copy of the study, or for additional information about our market research programs, please contact Lauren Reardon at (650) 322-8059, or visit our web site at http://www.radicati.com. About The Radicati Group, Inc. The Radicati Group covers all aspects of email security, email archiving, regulatory compliance, wireless technologies, web services, identity management, instant messaging, unified communications, VoIP, and more. The company provides both quantitative and qualitative information, including detailed market size, installed base and forecast information on a worldwide basis, as well as detailed country breakouts. The Radicati Group works with corporate organizations to assist them in selecting the right products and technologies to support their business needs, as well as with vendors to define the best strategic direction for their products. We also work with investment firms on a worldwide basis to help them identify and assess new investment opportunities. The Radicati Group, Inc. is headquartered in Palo Alto, CA, with offices in London, Hong Kong and Melbourne. Contact: Lauren Reardon The Radicati Group, Inc. (650) 322-8059 Email Contact Copyright 2009, Market Wire, All rights reserved. -0-

entry.author: Austin Ekeinde
entry.headline: Militants attack Chevron oil pipeline in Nigeria
entry.body:
PORT HARCOURT, Nigeria (Reuters) - An attack by suspected Nigerian militants on a Chevron (CVX.N) oil pipeline in the Niger Delta on Friday shut down around 10,000 barrels per day of output, a company source said on Monday.

The pipeline running from the Abiteye flow station near Warri in Delta state was attacked in the early hours of Friday morning, according to Colonel Rabe Abubakar, spokesman for the military taskforce in the western Niger Delta.

He said the strike had resulted in leakage into four communities in the area.

"There was an incident last week ... The amount of shut-in production is around 10,000 barrels per day," a source at Chevron told Reuters, asking not to be named.

Abubakar said the attackers were believed to have defected from the camp of militant leader Government Tompolo, who is based in Delta state.

"The group had threatened to continue with their attacks on installations and facilities unless they receive gratification from the multinationals," Abubakar said.

"This threat will not be allowed to continue."

Attacks on pipelines and industry installations are common in the Niger Delta, home to Africa's biggest oil and gas industry. The unrest has shut down more than a fifth of Nigerian oil output over the past three years.

Some attacks are carried out by militants who say they are fighting for a fairer share of the natural wealth, others by criminal gangs engaged in a multi-million-dollar trade in stolen oil. The crude is transported on barges to tankers waiting off Nigeria's coast before being mixed in with legitimate cargo.

Security experts say groups of local community youths, frustrated by poverty and a lack of job opportunities, also sabotage pipelines in the hope of winning repair contracts.

(For full Reuters Africa coverage and to have your say on the top issues, visit: af.reuters.com/ )

(Additional reporting by Randy Fabi in Abuja; Writing by Nick Tattersall; editing by James Jukwey)

entry.headline: Chevron oil pipeline attacked in Nigeria - army
entry.body:
PORT HARCOURT, Nigeria, March 16 (Reuters) - Suspected Nigerian militants attacked an oil pipeline operated by U.S. energy giant Chevron (CVX.N) in the southern Niger Delta on Friday, a military spokesman said on Monday.

Colonel Rabe Abubakar said the pipeline running from the Abiteye flow station near Warri in Delta state was attacked in the early hours of Friday morning. He said the strike had resulted in leakage into four communities in the area.

(For full Reuters Africa coverage and to have your say on the top issues, visit: af.reuters.com/ ) (Reporting by Austin Ekeinde; Writing by Nick Tattersall; Editing by Randy Fabi)

entry.author: None
entry.headline: The Coca-Cola Company stellt 30 Mio. US-Dollar für Trinkwasser-Projekte in Afrika bereit
entry.body: ATLANTA, USA--(Business Wire)-- Wie die Coca-Cola Company heute mitteilte, wird das Unternehmen im Verlauf der kommenden sechs Jahre seiner Initiative RAIN (Replenish Africa Initiative) 30 Mio. US-Dollar zur Verfügung stellen, um afrikanischen Gemeinden in verschiedenen Regionen des Kontinents Zugang zu sauberem Trinkwasser zu ermöglichen. Das RAIN-Projekt, implementiert von der Coca-Cola Africa Foundation, wird für mindestens zwei Millionen Afrikaner sauberes Wasser und Abwassersysteme bereitstellen. "Afrikas Wasserkrise bedroht die Gesundheit seiner Bevölkerung und damit auch seine Aussichten auf Wirtschaftswachstum", erklärt Muhtar Kent, Präsident und CEO der Coca-Cola Company. "Für ihre Entwicklung brauchen die Regionen Menschen in guter körperlicher Verfassung, und unser Unternehmen benötigt gesunde, prosperierende Regionen für nachhaltiges Wachstum. Die Unterstützung afrikanischer Gemeinden bei der Lösung der Wasserversorgungsprobleme genießt eine hohe Priorität bei der Coca-Cola Company und ihren Abfüllpartnern. In diesem Bereich sind positive und bleibende Resultate möglich." Der Weltgesundheitsorganisation zufolge verfügen mehr als 300 Millionen Afrikaner über keinen Zugang zu sicherem Trinkwasser. Millionen von ihnen sterben jährlich an vermeidbaren Erkrankungen aufgrund von verseuchtem Wasser. Fast die Hälfte der afrikanischen Bevölkerung leidet an Krankheiten, die auf verunreinigtes Trinkwasser und unzureichende sanitäre Einrichtungen zurückzuführen sind. Für den Zeitraum von 2004 bis 2015 wird mit dem Anstieg der Zahl der Menschen, die ohne Zugang zu sauberem Trinkwasser im subsaharischen Afrika leben, um weitere 47 Millionen gerechnet. Afrika wird die Millennium-Entwicklungsziele der Vereinten Nationen - Zugang zu sauberem Trinkwasser für 111 Millionen und Abwassersysteme für 289 Millionen Menschen - voraussichtlich verfehlen. "Eine einzelne Organisation kann die Probleme Afrikas nicht im Alleingang lösen, aber gemeinsam als Zivilgesellschaft, Nichtregierungsorganisationen und Regierungsorgane können wir das Leben der Menschen in den Gemeinden entscheidend verbessern", erklärt William Asiko, Präsident der Coca-Cola Africa Foundation. Die Coca-Cola Africa Foundation unterhält derzeit 19 Wasserprojekte in afrikanischen Ländern - Angola, Ägypten, Elfenbeinküste, Ghana, Kenia, Malawi, Mali, Marokko, Mosambik, Niger, Nigeria, Ruanda, Sambia, Senegal, Südafrika, Tansania, Tunesien und Uganda -, die mehr als 300.000 Menschen erreichen. Alle diese Wasserprojekte werden in Zusammenarbeit mit den Gemeinden vor Ort jedes Landes verwirklicht. Die Projekte sind darüber hinaus Teil des Vorhabens der Coca-Cola Company, den Gemeinden und der Natur die gleiche Menge an Wasser zurückzugeben, die für alle Getränke sowie deren Herstellung verbraucht wird. Die Strategie des Unternehmens zur Umsetzung dieses Ziels besteht aus drei Komponenten: * Reduzieren - Verbesserung der Wassereffizienz um 20 Prozent bis 2012 gegenüber dem Vergleichsjahr 2004. * Recycling - Rückführung des Wassers, das die Coca-Cola Company während des Herstellungsprozesses verbraucht, in einem Zustand, der Wasserflora und -fauna schont und die Verwendung für landwirtschaftliche Zwecke ermöglicht, bis Ende 2010. * Ausgleichen - Ausdehnung des Engagements des Unternehmens für natürliche Wasserscheiden um den Wasserverbrauch im Rahmen der Getränkeherstellung auszugleichen. "Der Zugang zu sauberem Wasser ist noch immer ein Luxusgut, das in weiten Teilen des Kontinents nicht verfügbar ist", so Asiko weiter. "RAIN ermöglicht uns die Erfüllung unserer Umweltziele und schafft konkrete Verbesserungen der Gesundheitsbedingungen, die für Wachstum und wirtschaftlichen Erfolg unserer Gemeinden und unseres Unternehmens entscheidend sind." Über The Coca-Cola Company The Coca-Cola Company ist das größte Getränkeunternehmen der Welt, das die Verbraucher mit über 500 sprudelnden und stillen Erfrischungsgetränken versorgt. Neben Coca-Cola, der weltweit als am wertvollsten angesehenen Marke, enthält das Unternehmensportfolio 12 weitere milliardenschwere Marken, darunter Diet Coke, Fanta, Sprite, Coca-Cola Zero, Vitamingetränke, POWERade, Minute Maid und Georgia Coffee. Wir sind als Anbieter kohlensäurehaltiger Getränke, Fruchtsäfte und Fruchtsaftgetränke sowie fertig zubereiteter Tees und Kaffees weltweiter Marktführer. Über das weltweit größte Getränkevertriebsnetz genießen Verbraucher in über 200 Ländern die Getränke des Unternehmens bei einem Absatz von 1,6 Milliarden Portionen pro Tag. Im Rahmen unseres langfristigen Engagements für eine nachhaltige Entwicklung von Gemeinden konzentriert sich unser Unternehmen auf Initiativen, die die Umwelt schützen, Ressourcen schonen und die wirtschaftliche Entwicklung der Gemeinden begünstigen, in denen wir tätig sind. Die Coca-Cola Company ist auf dem afrikanischen Markt etabliert. Das Unternehmen, das bereits 1928 in Südafrika seine ersten Aktivitäten auf dem Kontinent aufnahm, ist derzeit in 56 afrikanischen Ländern und Territorien vertreten und beschäftigt mehr als 60.000 Mitarbeiter innerhalb des Coca-Cola-Systems (Coca-Cola Company und Abfüllpartner). Nähere Informationen über unser Unternehmen erhalten Sie auf der Website www.thecoca-colacompany.com. Über die Coca-Cola Africa Foundation In dem Bewusstsein, dass die Aktivitäten eines Unternehmens nur so nachhaltig sein können wie die Regionen, in denen es aktiv ist, hat die Coca-Cola Company im Jahr 2001 die Coca-Cola Africa Foundation ins Leben gerufen, um ihre Entwicklungsinitiativen auf dem afrikanischen Kontinent umzusetzen. Mit der Implementierung von mehr als 130 Programmen in 32 Ländern Afrikas erreichte die Foundation seit ihrer Gründung über 1.000.000 Menschen. Das Ziel der Foundation besteht in der Entwicklung gesunder und prosperierender Gemeinden durch Investitionen in prioritäre Bereiche wie Wasserversorgung, Unternehmensgründung und Gesundheit. Die Vision der Coca-Cola Africa Foundation liegt in der Schaffung eines stabilen Fundaments für langfristig angelegtes, soziales und wirtschaftliches Wachstum, das einen Beitrag zur planmäßigen Erfüllung der Millenniumsziele der Vereinten Nationen leistet. Die Coca-Cola Africa Foundation verfügt über Programme in einigen der entlegendsten Regionen Afrikas und war bereits an verschiedenen humanitären Einsätzen auf dem gesamten Kontinent beteiligt. Die Programme der Coca-Cola Africa Foundation sollen darüber hinaus Mitarbeiter der Coca-Cola Company zur finanziellen oder praktischen Unterstützung der Aktivitäten anregen, indem diese Ihr Fachwissen und ihre Zeit zur Verfügung stellen. Nähere Informationen über die Coca-Cola Africa Foundation erhalten Sie auf www.thecoca-colacompany.com. Die Ausgangssprache, in der der Originaltext veröffentlicht wird, ist die offizielle und autorisierte Version. Übersetzungen werden zur besseren Verständigung mitgeliefert. Nur die Sprachversion, die im Original veröffentlicht wurde, ist rechtsgültig. Gleichen Sie deshalb Übersetzungen mit der originalen Sprachversion der Veröffentlichung ab. entry.author: None
entry.headline: The Coca-Cola Company asigna USD 30 millones a los proyectos de agua limpia en África
entry.body: ATLANTA--(Business Wire)-- The Coca-Cola Company anunció hoy que ha asignado USD 30 millones durante los próximos seis año para garantizar a todas las comunidades africanas el acceso a agua potable apta para el consumo a través de la Iniciativa de Reabastecimiento de África (RAIN, por sus siglas en inglés). Implementada por la Fundación Coca-Cola de África, en 2015 la RAIN proporcionará agua limpia y servicios sanitarios a al menos 2 millones de africanos. "La crisis de agua en África representa una amenaza para la salud de la población y, por lo tanto, sus perspectivas de crecimiento económico", dijo Muhtar Kent, Presidente y Director General de The Coca-Cola Company. "Las comunidades necesitan gente fuerte y sana para prosperar y nuestro negocio necesita comunidades fuertes y sanas para crecer y ser sostenible. Ayudar a las comunidades africanas a tratar de resolver los problemas de agua es una prioridad importante de nuestra Empresa y nuestros socios embotelladores, y asimismo es un área donde podemos tener un impacto positivo y duradero". Según la Organización Mundial de la Salud, más de 300 millones de africanos carecen de acceso a agua potable y millones de ellos mueren cada año a causa de enfermedades que se transmiten a través del agua y que se pueden evitar. Hasta la mitad de la población de la región en algún momento sufrió alguna enfermedad relacionada con agua potable no apta para el consumo y malos servicios sanitarios. Entre 2004 y 2015, se espera que la cantidad de gente sin acceso a agua apta para el consumo en África subsahariana aumente a 47 millones de personas. Se espera que África pierda la meta de los Objetivos de Desarrollo del Milenio de las Naciones Unidas para el acceso a agua potable por 111 millones de personas y la meta de servicios sanitarios por 289 millones. "Ninguna organización puede resolver los problemas de desarrollo de África, pero junto con sociedades cívicas, organizaciones gubernamentales y no gubernamentales podemos lograr un cambio positivo en las vidas de la gente que forma parte de nuestras comunidades", dijo William Asiko, Presidente de la Fundación Coca-Cola de África. En la actualidad, la Fundación Coca-Cola de África tiene proyectos de agua que llegan a más de 300.000 personas en 19 países africanos: Angola, Egipto, Etiopia, Ghana, Costa de Marfil, Kenia, Mali, Malawi, Marruecos, Mozambique, Níger, Nigeria, Ruanda, Senegal, Sudáfrica, Tanzania, Túnez, Uganda y Zambia. Estos proyectos de agua se implementan en colaboración con las comunidades locales de cada uno de los países. También colaboran con el objetivo de administración de agua al que aspira The Coca-Cola Company, que consiste en devolver a las comunidades y a la naturaleza una cantidad de agua equivalente a la que usamos en todas nuestras bebidas y su elaboración. La estrategia de la Empresa para lograr este objetivo consta de tres componentes: * Reducir: Para 2012 se mejorará el rendimiento del agua en un 20 por ciento, en comparación con el año básico de 2004. * Reciclar: Se devolverá al medio ambiente toda el agua que la Empresa usa en los procesos de fabricación a un nivel que soporte la vida acuática y la agricultura hacia fines de 2010. * Reabastecer: Se expandirá el apoyo de la Empresa a las cuencas saludables y los programas de agua comunitaria sostenibles, a fin de lograr un equilibrio del agua que se usa para las bebidas terminadas. "El acceso a agua limpia sigue siendo un lujo, no un hecho, en muchas partes del continente", dijo Asiko. "RAIN nos ayuda a cumplir con nuestros objetivos ambientales y al mismo tiempo nos ofrece beneficios de salud que permitirán a nuestras comunidades y negocios crecer y prosperar". Acerca de The Coca-Cola Company The Coca-Cola Company es la empresa de bebidas más grande del mundo, que refresca a los consumidores con aproximadamente 500 bebidas con y sin gas. Junto con Coca-Cola, reconocida como la marca más valiosa del mundo, la cartera de la Empresa incluye otras 12 marcas de mil millones de dólares, entre las que se incluyen Coca-Cola Diet, Fanta, Sprite, Coca-Cola Zero, vitaminwater, POWERADE, Minute Maid y Georgia Coffee. Somos el proveedor N.º 1 del mundo de bebidas gasificadas, jugos, aguas frescas, así como té y café listo para beber. A través del sistema de distribución más grande del mundo, los consumidores de más de 200 países disfrutan de las bebidas de la Empresa a una tasa de aproximadamente 1,6 mil millones de consumiciones por día. Con el compromiso perdurable de desarrollar comunidades sostenibles, nuestra Empresa se concentra en iniciativas que protegen el medio ambiente, conservan recursos y mejoran el desarrollo económico de las comunidades en las que operamos. The Coca-Cola Company tiene un reconocido prestigio en África. La primera vez que la Empresa operó en Sudáfrica fue en 1928 y en la actualidad opera en los 56 países y territorios del continente y tiene más de 60.000 empleados en el sistema de Coca-Cola (nuestra Empresa y los socios embotelladores). Para mayor información sobre nuestra Empresa, visite nuestro sitio web www.thecoca-colacompany.com. Acerca de la Fundación Coca-Cola de África Dado que reconoce que sus negocios son tan sostenibles como las comunidades en las que opera, en 2001 The Coca-Cola Company creó la Fundación Coca-Cola de África a fin de implementar las iniciativas comunitarias de la Empresa en África. Mediante la implementación de más de 130 programas en 32 países de África, los programas de la Fundación han llegado a más de 1.000.000 personas desde sus comienzos. El objetivo de la Fundación es desarrollar comunidades sanas y prósperas mediante la inversión en las áreas de prioridad: agua, empresas, educación y salud. La visión de la Fundación Coca-Cola de África es establecer una base sólida para el crecimiento económico y social a largo plazo del continente, lo que contribuye con el logro oportuno de los Objetivos de Desarrollo del Milenio de las Naciones Unidas. La Fundación Coca-Cola de África tiene programas en algunos de los lugares más remotos de África y ha participado en varios esfuerzos de asistencia humanitaria en todo el continente. Los programas de la Fundación Coca-Cola de África también están diseñados para permitir que los empleados de Coca-Cola contribuyan, ya sea financieramente, a través de nuestro programa para empleados o en especies, poniendo su experiencia y tiempo al servicio de las actividades y los programas de la Fundación. Para mayor información sobre la Fundación Coca-Cola de África, visite www.thecoca-colacompany.com. El texto original en el idioma fuente de este comunicado es la versión oficial autorizada. Las traducciones solo se suministran como adaptación y deben cotejarse con el texto en el idioma fuente, que es la única versión del texto que tendrá un efecto legal. The Coca-Cola Company Racquel White, +90530 202 0495 racquwhite@afr.ko.com Copyright Business Wire 2009

entry.headline: The Coca-Cola Company s'engage à investir 30 millions de dollars pour des projets d'assainissement d'eau en Afrique
entry.body: ATLANTA--(Business Wire)-- The Coca-Cola Company a annoncé aujourd'hui son engagement à investir 30 millions de dollars au cours des six prochaines années pour garantir l'accès à l'eau potable aux communautés africaines, dans le cadre de son initiative RAIN (Replenish Africa Initiative). Mise en place par la Fondation Coca-Cola pour l'Afrique, RAIN fournira de l'eau potable et des mesures d'assainissement à au moins 2 millions d'Africains d'ici 2015. « La crise de l'eau en Afrique menace la santé de sa population et, partant, ses perspectives de croissance économique, » déclare Muhtar Kent, président-directeur général de The Coca-Cola Company. « Pour prospérer, les communautés doivent pouvoir compter sur une population forte et saine, et pour croître et devenir durable, notre entreprise doit aussi reposer sur des communautés fortes et saines. Aider les communautés africaines à s'attaquer aux problèmes d'eau auxquels elles font face est une priorité importante pour notre société et pour nos partenaires de l'industrie ; c'est un domaine dans lequel nous pouvons laisser un impact positif et durable. » Selon l'Organisation mondiale de la santé, plus de 300 millions d'Africains n'ont pas accès à l'eau potable et des millions d'entre eux meurent chaque année des suites de maladies d'origine hydrique qui auraient pu être évitées. La moitié de la population de la région, à tout moment donné, souffre de maladies liées au manque d'eau potable et d'hygiène. Entre 2004 et 2015, le nombre de personnes vivant sans accès à l'eau potable en Afrique sub-saharienne devrait augmenter de 47 millions de personnes. L'Afrique aura du mal à atteindre l'objectif du développement pour le millénaire des Nations Unies en matière d'accès à l'eau potable par l11 millions de personnes et à des conditions sanitaires acceptables par 289 millions de personnes. « Aucune organisation ne peut résoudre les problèmes de développement de l'Afrique mais en collaboration avec la société civile, les organisations non gouvernementales et les gouvernements, nous pouvons améliorer la vie des personnes qui forment nos communautés, » explique William Asiko, président de la Fondation Coca-Cola pour l'Afrique. La fondation gère actuellement des projets sur l'eau dans 19 pays africains : Afrique du Sud, Angola, Côte d'Ivoire, Égypte, Éthiopie, Ghana, Kenya, Mali, Malawi, Maroc, Mozambique, Niger, Nigeria, Ouganda, Rwanda, Sénégal, Tanzanie, Tunisie et Zambie, touchant plus de 300 000 personnes. Ces projets sur l'eau sont tous mis en place dans le cadre de partenariats avec les communautés locales de chaque pays. Ils contribuent aussi à l'objectif ambitieux de responsabilité de l'eau, dont s'est fixé The Coca-Cola Company, consistant à retourner aux communautés et à la nature une quantité d'eau équivalente à ce qu'elle utilise dans toutes ses boissons et leur production. La stratégie de la société pour atteindre cet objectif présente trois volets : * Réduction - Améliorer l'efficacité hydrique de 20 pour cent d'ici 2012, par rapport à 2004, l'année de base. * Recyclage - Restituer à l'environnement toute l'eau que la société utilise dans ses processus de fabrication, à un niveau suffisant pour prendre en charge la vie aquatique et l'agriculture d'ici la fin de 2010. * Réapprovisionnement - Élargir la prise en charge par la sociétéde bassins hydrographiques sains et de programmes d'approvisionnement durable en eau aux collectivités pour compenser l'eau utilisée dans ses boissons finies. « L'accès à l'eau potable reste un véritable luxe dans de grandes parties du continent, » déclare M. Asiko. « L'initiative RAIN nous aide à la fois à atteindre nos objectifs environnementaux et à offrir des avantages sanitaires qui permettront à nos communautés et à notre entreprise de croître et de prospérer. » À propos de The Coca-Cola Company The Coca-Cola Company, le plus important producteur mondial de boissons, rafraîchit les consommateurs avec sa gamme de plus de 500 marques de boissons pétillantes et plates. En plus du Coca-Cola, une boisson qui est reconnue comme sa marque de plus grande valeur mondiale, le portefeuille de la société comprend douze autres marques au chiffre d'affaires atteignant le milliard de dollars, notamment Diet Coke, Fanta, Sprite, Coca-Cola Zero, vitaminwater, POWERADE, Minute Maid et Georgia Coffee. À l'échelle mondiale, la société est le fournisseur numéro un de boissons gazeuses, de jus de fruits et de boissons à base de jus de fruits, ainsi que de thés et de cafés prêts à consommer. Grâce au plus important système de distribution de boissons au monde, les consommateurs de plus de 200 pays peuvent profiter des boissons de la société à raison de 1,6 milliard de boissons servies par jour. Par son indéfectible engagement envers la construction de communautés durables, la société se concentre sur les initiatives qui protègent l`environnement, conservent les ressources et font progresser le développement économique des communautés où elle exerce son activité. The Coca-Cola Company a établi sa présence en Afrique. Aves ses premières installations en Afrique du Sud en 1928, la société est implantée actuellement dans les 56 pays et territoires du continent, employant plus de 60 000 personnes dans le réseau Coca-Cola (notre société et ses partenaires de l'industrie). Pour en savoir davantage sur la société, veuillez consulter le site www.thecoca-colacompany.com. À propos de la Fondation Coca-Cola pour l'Afrique Reconnaissant que la durabilité de ses activités dépend directement de celle des communautés dans lesquelles elle est implantée, The Coca-Cola Company a établi la Fondation Coca-Cola pour l'Afrique en 2001 pour mettre en oeuvre les initiatives communautaires de la société en Afrique. Englobant plus de 130 programmes dans 32 pays africains, la fondation a desservi plus de 1 000 000 personnes depuis sa création. La fondation vise à l'autonomisation de communautés saines et prospères en investissant dans les domaines prioritaires fondamentaux que sont l'eau, l'entrepreneuriat, l'éducation et la santé. La vision de la Fondation Coca-Cola pour l'Afrique est d'établir une base solide favorable à la croissance économique et sociale à long terme du continent, permettant d'atteindre dans les temps les Objectifs de développement pour le millénaire des Nations Unies. La Fondation Coca-Cola pour l'Afrique gère des programmes dans certaines des régions les plus reculées de l'Afrique et participe à un certain nombre d'initiatives de secours humanitaire dans tout le continent. Les programmes de la fondation sont aussi conçus pour permettre aux employés de Coca-Cola de contribuer, soit financièrement, par son programme de contributions paritaires, soit en personne, en prêtant leur expertise et leur temps aux activités et programmes de la fondation. Pour en savoir davantage sur la Fondation Coca-Cola pour l'Afrique, veuillez consulter le site www.thecoca-colacompany.com. Le texte du communiqué issu d`une traduction ne doit d`aucune manière être considéré comme officiel. La seule version du communiqué qui fasse foi est celle du communiqué dans sa langue d`origine. La traduction devra toujours être confrontée au texte source, qui fera jurisprudence. The Coca-Cola Company Racquel White, +90530 202 0495 racquwhite@afr.ko.com Copyright Business Wire 2009

entry.headline: The Coca-Cola Company se compromete com US$30 milhões para projetos de água limpa por toda a África
entry.body: ATLANTA--(Business Wire)-- The Coca-Cola Company anunciou hoje que se comprometeu com US$30 milhões durante os próximos seis anos para fornecer acesso à água potável segura a comunidades por toda a África através de sua iniciativa Replenish Africa Initiative (RAIN, Iniciativa Reabastecer África). Implementada pela The Coca-Cola Africa Foundation, a RAIN vai fornecer água limpa e saneamento a pelo menos 2 milhões de africanos até 2015. "A crise hídrica em África ameaça a saúde da população e, desta forma, suas perspectivas de crescimento econômico", disse Muhtar Kent, presidente e diretor executivo da The Coca-Cola Company. "As comunidades precisam de pessoas fortes e saudáveis para prosperar, e a nossa empresa precisa que comunidades fortes e saudáveis cresçam e sejam sustentáveis. Ajudar as comunidades africanas a tentar resolver seus desafios hídricos é uma prioridade importante para a nossa empresa e para nossos parceiros engarrafadores e é uma área onde podemos ter um impacto positivo e duradouro." De acordo com a Organização Mundial de Saúde, mais de 300 milhões de africanos não têm acesso à água potável, e milhões morrem a cada ano devido a doenças tratáveis transportadas pela água. Em qualquer tempo até metade da população da região sofre de doenças relacionadas com água potável insegura e parco saneamento. Entre 2004 e 2015, está estimado que o número de pessoas vivendo sem acesso à água potável segura na África Sub-Saara aumente em 47 milhões de pessoas. A estimativa é que a África não consiga cumprir a meta dos Objetivos de Desenvolvimento do Milênio das Nações Unidas de acesso à água potável limpa por 111 milhões de pessoas e a meta de saneamento por 289 milhões. "Nenhuma organização sozinha pode resolver os desafios de desenvolvimento da África, mas em conjunto com a sociedade cívica, organizações não-governamentais e o governo podemos fazer uma diferença positiva nas vidas das pessoas que fazem parte das nossas comunidades", disse William Asiko, presidente da The Coca-Cola Africa Foundation. Atualmente a The Coca-Cola Africa Foundation possui projetos hídricos em 19 países africanos - Angola, Egito, Etiópia, Gana, Costa do Marfim, Quênia, Mali, Malawi, Marrocos, Moçambique, Níger, Nigéria, Ruanda, Senegal, África do Sul, Tanzânia, Tunísia, Uganda e Zâmbia - alcançando mais de 300.000 pessoas. Estes projetos hídricos são todos implementados em parceria com as comunidades locais em cada país. Também contribuem para a meta de intendência hídrica aspirada pela The Coca-Cola Company de devolver para as comunidades e para a natureza uma quantidade de água equivalente à que usamos em todas as nossas bebidas e respectiva produção. A estratégia da empresa para alcançar esta meta é composta por três componentes: * Reduzir - Melhorar a eficiência da água em 20% até 2012, comparado com 2004 como linha de base. * Reciclar - Devolver toda a água que a empresa usa para os processos de produção ao ambiente em um nível que suporte a vida aquática e a agricultura até o final de 2010. * Reabastecer - Expandir o suporte da empresaa bacias hidrográficas saudáveis e programas hídricos comunitários sustentáveis para equilibrar a água usada em suas bebidas acabadas. "Ter acesso à água limpa ainda é um luxo, e não uma premissa, em grandes partes do continente", disse Asiko. "A RAIN nos ajuda a cumprir nossas metas ambientais, e ao mesmo tempo também fornece benefícios de saúde que vão permitir que as nossas comunidades e nossa empresa cresçam e prosperem." Sobre The Coca-Cola Company The Coca-Cola Company é a maior empresa de bebidas do mundo, oferecendo aos consumidores mais de 500 marcas de bebidas gasosas e não-gasosas. Além da Coca-Cola, reconhecida como a marca mais valiosa do mundo, o portfólio da empresa inclui 12 marcas com valor de bilhões de dólares, incluindo Diet Coke, Fanta, Sprite, Coca-Cola Zero, vitaminwater, POWERADE, Minute Maid e Georgia Coffee. Em nível global, somos a maior fornecedora de bebidas gasosas, sucos e bebidas à base de suco, além de chás e cafés prontos para beber. Por meio do maior sistema de distribuição de bebidas do mundo, consumidores de mais de 200 países saboreiam as bebidas da empresa a uma taxa de quase 1,6 bilhão de doses por dia. Com um compromisso permanente de construir comunidades sustentáveis, nossa empresa está concentrada em iniciativas voltadas para a proteção do meio ambiente, conservação de recursos e melhoria do desenvolvimento econômico das comunidades onde atuamos. The Coca-Cola Company possui uma presença estabelecida em África. Com suas primeiras operações na África do Sul em 1928, a empresa opera atualmente em todos os 56 países e territórios no continente, empregando mais de 60 mil funcionários no sistema Coca-Cola (nossa empresa e nossos parceiros engarrafadores). Para obter informações adicionais sobre a nossa empresa, visite nosso site em www.thecoca-colacompany.com. Sobre The Coca-Cola Africa Foundation Reconhecendo que a sustentabilidade da empresa depende da sustentabilidade das comunidades onde atua, a The Coca-Cola Company estabeleceu a The Coca-Cola Africa Foundation em 2001 para implementar as iniciativas comunitárias da empresa em África. Implementando mais de 130 programas em 32 países em África, os programas da fundação alcançaram mais de 1.000.000 pessoas desde o princípio. A meta da fundação é permitir que as comunidades sejam saudáveis e prósperas investindo nas seguintes áreas prioritárias essenciais: água, capacidade empresarial, educação e saúde. A visão da The Coca-Cola Africa Foundation é estabelecer uma forte base para o crescimento econômico e social do continente em longo prazo, contribuindo para o alcance pontual dos Objetivos de Desenvolvimento do Milênio das Nações Unidas. A The Coca-Cola Africa Foundation tem programas em alguns dos locais mais remotos da África, e tem estado envolvida em inúmeras iniciativas de alívio humanitário em todo o continente. Os programas da The Coca-Cola Africa Foundation também são projetados para permitir que os funcionários da Coca-Cola contribuam, quer financeiramente, através do nosso programa de correlação de funcionários, ou em espécie, oferecendo sua experiência e tempo para as atividades e programas da fundação. Para obter informações adicionais sobre a The Coca-Cola Africa Foundation, visite www.thecoca-colacompany.com. O texto no idioma original deste anúncio é a versão oficial autorizada. As traduções são fornecidas apenas como uma facilidade e devem se referir ao texto no idioma original, que é a única versão do texto que tem efeito legal. entry.headline: The Coca-Cola Company Commits US$30 Million to Clean Water Projects across Africa
entry.body: ATLANTA--(Business Wire)-- The Coca-Cola Company announced today that it has committed US $30MM over the next six years to provide access to safe drinking water to communities throughout Africa through its Replenish Africa Initiative (RAIN). Implemented by The Coca-Cola Africa Foundation, RAIN will provide at least 2 million Africans with clean water and sanitation by 2015. "Africa`s water crisis threatens the health of its population and, therefore, its prospects for economic growth," said Muhtar Kent, President and CEO of The Coca-Cola Company. "Communities need strong, healthy people to thrive, and our business needs strong, healthy communities to grow and be sustainable. Helping African communities tackle their water challenges is an important priority for our Company and our bottling partners and is an area where we can make a positive and lasting impact." According to the World Health Organization, more than 300 million Africans lack access to safe drinking water, and millions of them die each year from preventable waterborne illnesses. Up to half of the region`s population at any one time suffers from diseases related to unsafe drinking water and poor sanitation. Between 2004 and 2015, the number of people living without access to safe water in sub-Saharan Africa is expected to increase by 47 million people. Africa is expected to miss the United Nations` Millennium Development Goals target for access to clean drinking water by 111 million people and the sanitation target by 289 million. "No single organization can resolve Africa`s development challenges, but together with civic society, nongovernmental organizations and government we can make a positive difference in the lives of the people who make up our communities," said William Asiko, President of The Coca-Cola Africa Foundation. The Coca-Cola Africa Foundation currently has water projects in 19 African countries - Angola, Egypt, Ethiopia, Ghana, Cote d` Ivoire, Kenya, Mali, Malawi, Morocco, Mozambique, Niger, Nigeria, Rwanda, Senegal, South Africa, Tanzania, Tunisia, Uganda and Zambia - reaching over 300,000 people. These water projects are all implemented in partnership with local communities in each country. They also contribute to The Coca-Cola Company`s aspirational water stewardship goal of returning to communities and to nature an amount of water equivalent to what we use in all of our beverages and their production. The Company`s strategy for achieving that goal has three components: * Reduce - Improving water efficiency by 20 percent by 2012, compared to a baseline year 2004. * Recycle - Returning all water the Company uses for manufacturing processes to the environment at a level that supports aquatic life and agriculture by the end of 2010. * Replenish - Expanding the Company`s supportof healthy watersheds and sustainable community water programs to balance the water used in its finished beverages. "Having access to clean water still remains a luxury, not a given, in large parts of the continent," Asiko said. "RAIN helps us both fulfill our environmental goals while also providing health benefits that will allow our communities and our business to grow and prosper." About The Coca-Cola Company The Coca-Cola Company is the world`s largest beverage company, refreshing consumers with nearly 500 sparkling and still brands. Along with Coca-Cola, recognized as the world`s most valuable brand, the Company`s portfolio includes 12 other billion dollar brands, including Diet Coke, Fanta, Sprite, Coca-Cola Zero, vitaminwater, POWERADE, Minute Maid and Georgia Coffee. Globally, we are the No. 1 provider of sparkling beverages, juices and juice drinks and ready-to-drink teas and coffees. Through the world`s largest beverage distribution system, consumers in more than 200 countries enjoy the Company`s beverages at a rate of nearly 1.6 billion servings a day. With an enduring commitment to building sustainable communities, our Company is focused on initiatives that protect the environment, conserve resources and enhance the economic development of the communities where we operate. The Coca-Cola Company has an established presence in Africa. With its first operations in South Africa in 1928, the Company currently operates in all 56 countries and territories on the continent, employing over 60,000 people in the Coca-Cola system (our Company and our bottling partners). For more information about our Company, please visit our website at www.thecoca-colacompany.com. About The Coca-Cola Africa Foundation Recognizing that its business is only as sustainable as the communities in which it operates, The Coca-Cola Company established The Coca-Cola Africa Foundation in 2001 to implement the Company`s community initiatives in Africa. Implementing over 130 programs in 32 countries across Africa, the Foundation`s programs have reached over 1,000,000 people since its inception. The Foundation aims to enable healthy, prosperous communities by investing in the critical priority areas of Water, Entrepreneurship, Education and Health. The Coca-Cola Africa Foundation`s vision is to establish a strong base for the continent`s long-term social and economic growth, contributing to the timely attainment of the UN Millennium Development Goals. The Coca-Cola Africa Foundation has programs in some of Africa`s most remote locations and has been involved in a number of humanitarian relief efforts across the continent. The Coca-Cola Africa Foundation`s programs are also designed to enable Coca-Cola employees to contribute, either financially, through our employee-matching program, or in kind, by lending their expertise and time to the Foundation`s activities and programs. For more information about The Coca-Cola Africa Foundation, please visit www.thecoca-colacompany.com. The Coca-Cola Company Racquel White, +90530 202 0495 racquwhite@afr.ko.com Copyright Business Wire 2009

entry.headline: Huiyuan Juice shares suspended amid Coca-Cola deal concern
entry.body:
HONG KONG (Reuters) - Trading in shares of China Huiyuan Juice Group Ltd (1886.HK) was suspended on Wednesday after they fell as much as 23 percent in early trade on a report that Coca-Cola (KO.N) may drop its roughly $2.4 billion plan to take over the company.

The Hong Kong exchange said a statement was pending. No further details were immediately available.

entry.headline: Goldman Sachs says it is not a bidder for Satyam
entry.body:
BANGALORE (Reuters) - Goldman Sachs (GS.N) said on Tuesday a newspaper report it was a potential investor in fraud-hit Indian outsourcer Satyam Computer Services SATY.BO was incorrect.

"Goldman Sachs is the advisor to the Satyam Board on the sale of the company and will not participate in the auction of the company in any other capacity," the Wall Street bank said in a statement emailed to Reuters on Tuesday.

The Economic Times had reported Goldman Sachs was among a clutch of private equity companies, who were in discussion with India's Larsen Toubro (LART.BO) to bid for Satyam. The paper had also said it was evaluating making an individual bid.

Bidders for a 51 percent stake in the outsourcing firm must submit detailed expressions of interest by Friday.

(Reporting by Sumeet Chatterjee; Editing by John Mair)

entry.headline: Huiyuan plunges 22 percent on Coca-Cola deal concerns
entry.body:
HONG KONG (Reuters) - Shares of China's top juice maker Huiyuan Juice (1886.HK) fell 22 percent on Wednesday after a report that Coca-Cola (KO.N) may drop its roughly $2.4 billion plan to take over the company.

Coca-Cola might drop its proposal to buy out Huiyuan Juice after Chinese anti-trust regulators signaled it would have to relinquish the China Huiyuan Juice brand after the acquisition, the Financial Times reported on Wednesday.

Shares of Huiyuan opened at HK$8.00, down 22.3 percent, and were down 18.25 percent shortly after the opening.

Coca-Cola spokesman Kenth Kaerhoeg said in an e-mailed statement to Reuters that it would be inappropriate to comment on the approval process.

"We are focused on the regulatory approval process. We are in very regular contact with the MOC, and we try to be as helpful as possible in answering questions and providing supplementary information," he said.

(US$1=HK$7.8)

(Reporting by Donny Kwok and Fion Li; editing by Ken Wills)

entry.author: Paritosh Bansal
entry.headline: Goldman's share of AIG bailout money draws fire
entry.body:
NEW YORK (Reuters) - American International Group(AIG.N) funneled over $90 billion of taxpayer bailout funds to various U.S. and European banks, but the biggest beneficiary was politically connected Goldman Sachs Group Inc (GS.N).

Suspicions of potential conflicts of interest and favoritism have been fueled by $12.9 billion AIG paid to Goldman Sachs -- where then-Treasury Secretary Henry Paulson had previously worked as chief executive -- in the months after the insurer was rescued by the government last September.

Goldman, for its part, has insisted it did not need the bailout money because it was "always fully collateralized and hedged."

Long Wall Street's largest investment bank before it recently became a bank holding company, Goldman answered a series of questions from Reuters about the bailout funds.

"We can say that our notional exposure to AIG is a fraction of what it was at the time of the September bailout," Goldman spokesman Michael DuVally said.

Asked why Goldman Sachs took $12.9 billion of taxpayer money if it was collateralized and hedged on its AIG positions, DuVally said it was because AIG was not allowed to fail, so Goldman did not get money from hedges that would have paid out if the insurer had collapsed. And, he said, under the terms of its contracts with AIG, Goldman was entitled to collateral.

DuVally also said the bank does extensive due diligence on all its counterparties.

How much Goldman and other counterparties received from AIG has been just one of several flashpoints over the taxpayer rescue of what was once the world's largest insurer.

AIG has also infuriated politicians -- including U.S. President Barack Obama -- with its plan to pay $165 million in bonuses to employees at the unit at the heart of its problems.

Still, the payments to counterparties like Goldman Sachs dwarfed the bonuses, and some experts contend that these companies should have been made to share some of the losses resulting from the giant insurance firm's near collapse.

"People see that the guys that ruined AIG are getting paid more money, and that creates outrage," said Porter Stansberry, managing director of Stansberry Associates Investment Research. "If you want to be outraged, be outraged that the counterparties got paid out full value."

Goldman was not the only large bank with exposure to AIG. The list of counterparties that AIG disclosed on Sunday included others that got large sums. Goldman was followed by Societe Generale (SOGN.PA) with $11.9 billion, Deutsche Bank (DBKGn.DE) with $11.8 billion and Barclays PLC (BARC.L) with $8.5 billion.

Moreover, the AIG disclosures are still incomplete in that they do not include payments to the banks since December 31.

"We are looking at a small piece of it right here. So what is the total exposure? That's the question. And then the issue is, well, if that was wiped out what would it do to Goldman's capital?" said Campbell Harvey, a finance professor at Duke University.

"It is obvious that firms underestimated the counterparty risk. That was their mistake," Harvey said. "Yet they are getting bailouts of U.S. taxpayer money. Why should we pay for their mistake?"

In an editorial on Tuesday, the Wall Street Journal pointed to Goldman's claim that "all of its AIG bets were adequately hedged and that it needed no 'bailout.'"

"Why take $13 billion then? This needless cover-up is one reason Americans are getting angrier as they wonder if Washington is lying to them about these bailouts," the Journal said.

The bailout has stirred resentment not just in the U.S. Congress, but on Wall Street, where investors have speculated that Goldman and its connections helped it get a better deal.

In recent years, many former Goldman executives have moved into government. Paulson left Goldman in 2006 as chief executive. The chairman of the New York Federal Reserve is former Goldman Chairman Steve Friedman.

"The person that should be subpoenaed is Hank Paulson. How do you go from running Goldman Sachs in '05 and '06 and making all of these bets with AIG's financial products unit and then end up in the government guaranteeing those bets and not have a conflict of interest?" Stansberry asked.

DuVally said Goldman Sachs was not party to any discussions about the bailout of AIG.

(Reporting by Paritosh Bansal; Additional reporting by Lilla Zuill and Kevin Drawbaugh; Editing by Gary Hill)

(For more MA news and our DealZone blog, go to www.reuters.com/deals)

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Q&A with Goldman Sachs over AIG bailout
entry.body:
NEW YORK, March 17 (Reuters) - Goldman Sachs Group Inc (GS.N) got the largest chunk of U.S. taxpayer money that found its way to companies that were on the other end of certain transactions with American International Group Inc (AIG.N).

Rep. Paul Kanjorski, whose House Subcommittee on Capital Markets and Insurance will quiz AIG Chief Executive Edward Liddy, said last weekend the counterparties and bonuses paid to AIG employees will topics for investigation at a hearing on Wednesday.

A day ahead of the hearing, Reuters posed 10 questions to Goldman about these issues. The following are the questions and the answers from Goldman spokesman Michael DuVally:

QUESTION: If Goldman Sachs was collateralized and hedged on its AIG positions, why did it take $12.9 billion of taxpayer money?

ANSWER: "Goldman Sachs has maintained that its exposure to AIG was collateralized and hedged. The majority of Goldman Sachs' CDS (credit default swap) exposure to AIG Financial Group was collateralized. That means that Goldman Sachs had collateral. To the extent it wasn't collateralized, Goldman Sachs hedged its exposure via the credit default swaps market. If the government had allowed AIG to fail, Goldman Sachs would have received its collateral. A credit event would be triggered, and Goldman Sachs would receive a payout from the credit default swap insurance that it had. This is from other counterparties."

Separating out the money Goldman received due to AIG's securities lending obligations, DuVally said: "AIG was not allowed to fail. So there was no payout from the hedges. Additionally after the bailout there was some additional deterioration in AIG's position. Under the terms of the contracts that Goldman Sachs had with AIG, it was entitled to collateral. We were always fully collateralized and hedged."

QUESTION: Did then-U.S. Treasury Secretary Henry Paulson or his aides discuss Goldman's exposure to AIG with Goldman Chief Executive Lloyd Blankfein or any other executive or director of the bank? Also, if they did, what was the substance of the conversations, and did Goldman Sachs take any position on whether AIG should be saved?

ANSWER: "Goldman Sachs was not party to any discussions about the bailout of AIG."

QUESTION: Did Goldman do any due diligence on AIG before buying credit default swaps (CDS) from it?

ANSWER: "We do extensive due diligence on all our counterparties."

QUESTION: From what other institutions did Goldman buy CDSs to insure its collateralized debt obligations or other securities?

ANSWER: "We do not disclose counterparty information."

QUESTION: How did Goldman account for the counterparty risk in its dealings with AIG?

ANSWER: "We made sure our positions with AIG were collateralized and hedged."

QUESTION: Did Goldman have more exposure to AIG through CDSs than that disclosed by AIG on Sunday? If yes, how much is/was that exposure?

ANSWER: "The disclosures by AIG encompass all the collateral received by Goldman Sachs on its credit default swap positions with AIG financial products for the period from September through the end of the year."

QUESTION: Why did Goldman decide to close its securities lending transactions with AIG?

ANSWER: "AIG could not return the cash it owed to Goldman Sachs under the terms of the transaction. It was the terms of the agreement. Note that Goldman Sachs had the ability all along if AIG could not honor its transaction to sell those securities into the market. Note that those securities which still had value went back to the government."

QUESTION: Was the value of the securities returned to AIG less than the cash received from AIG?

ANSWER: "They were equivalent. Under the terms of the agreement if the securities Goldman Sachs borrowed had declined in value, Goldman Sachs had the right to request that part of the cash collateral it posted to AIG be returned."

QUESTION: Has Goldman Sachs received more money from AIG to satisfy counterparty obligations since the end of 2008, and what did it receive before Sept. 16?

ANSWER: "We are not disclosing the amount of collateral we received from AIG before the government bailout nor after the end of 2008. We can say that our notional exposure to AIG is a fraction of what it was at the time of the September bailout. And as has been the case, our exposure remains collateralized and hedged." (To read related ANALYSIS, double-click [ID:nN17127064]) (For more MA news and our DealZone blog, go to www.reuters.com/deals) (Editing by Jeffrey Benkoe)

entry.headline: Fitch Downgrades 7 Classes of JPMCC Series 2005-LDP1; Assigns Outlooks
entry.body: NEW YORK--(Business Wire)-- Fitch Ratings downgrades and assigns Rating outlooks to the following classes of J.P. Morgan Chase Commercial Mortgage Securities Corp. (JPMCC), series 2005-LDP1, commercial mortgage pass-through certificates: --$32.4 million class H to 'BB+' from 'BBB-'; Outlook Negative; --$10.8 million class J to 'BB' from 'BB+'; Outlook Negative; --$14.4 million class K to 'B+' from 'BB'; Outlook Negative; --$10.8 million class L to 'B' from 'BB-'; Outlook Negative; --$7.2 million class M to 'B-' from 'B+'; Outlook Negative; --$7.2 million class N to 'B-' from 'B'; Outlook Negative; --$10.8 million class P to 'CCC/DR1' from 'B-/DR1'. In addition, Fitch has affirmed and assigned outlooks to the following classes: --$3.1 million class A-1 at 'AAA'; Outlook Stable; --$316.5 million class A-1A at 'AAA'; Outlook Stable; --$994.5 million class A-2 at 'AAA'; Outlook Stable; --$157.5 million class A-3 at 'AAA'; Outlook Stable; --$601.5 million class A-4 at 'AAA'; Outlook Stable; --$119.9 million class A-SB at 'AAA'; Outlook Stable; --$94.3 million class A-J at 'AAA'; Outlook Stable; --$100 million class A-JFL at 'AAA'; Outlook Stable; --Interest only class X-1 at 'AAA'; Outlook Stable; --Interest only class X-2 at 'AAA'; Outlook Stable; --$68.4 million class B at 'AA+'; Outlook Stable; --$25.2 million class C at 'AA'; Outlook Stable; --$54 million class D at 'A+'; Outlook Stable; --$28.8 million class E at 'A-'; Outlook Stable; --$46.8 million class F at 'BBB+'; Outlook Negative; --$28.8 million class G at 'BBB'; Outlook Negative. The $16.7 million class NR is not rated by Fitch. The downgrades are the result of an increase in specially serviced loans and Fitch expected losses. Rating Outlooks reflect the likely direction of any rating changes over the next one to two years. As of the February 2009 distribution report, the pool's aggregate certificate balance was reduced to 4.5% to $2.45 billion from $2.88 billion at issuance. Twenty loans (9.7%) are currently defeased. Currently, Fitch has identified 28 Loans of Concern (7.1%), including the seven specially serviced loans (1.1%). The largest specially serviced loan (0.4%) is a 313 unit multifamily property in Houston, TX. The property is 60 days + delinquent. The borrower continues to work on stabilizing the property and has settled outstanding litigation from previous management. As of June 2008, the servicer reported occupancy was 79% with a debt service coverage ratio (DSCR) of 0.75 times (x). The second largest specially serviced loan (0.2%) is secured by a 14,822 square foot (sf) retail property in Glendale, AZ. The loan transferred to the special servicer due to imminent default due to tenant vacancy. The third (0.1%) and fourth (0.1%) largest specially serviced loans are secured by a 82,788 sf office property and a 122,645 sf industrial property in Indianapolis and Portage, IN. The loans have the same sponsor, DBSI Inc. and were transferred to the special servicer in December 2008. The sponsor and master lease for the properties have declared bankruptcy and are subject to a class action law suit from the Tenants In Common Investors. As of June 2008, the servicer reported occupancy were 100% for both properties. Fitch reviewed the most recent servicer provided operating statement analysis reports for the two shadow rated loans, Woodbridge Center (7.6%) and Harbor Court (1.0%). The Woodbridge Center loan is secured by a regional mall located in Woodbridge, NJ. As of September 2008, occupancy at Woodbridge Center has improved to 99% from 95% at issuance. One of the major tenants, Fortunoff representing 9% of the net rentable area (NRA) of the mall and 27% NRA of the collateral declared bankruptcy; however, accounts for less than 5% of the gross potential rent. There are no co-tenancy clauses related to the Fortunoff space. The loan is scheduled to mature in June 2009 and there are no contract extensions. The sponsor of the loan is General Growth Properties and has an interest rate of 4.24%. The loan no longer maintains an investment grade shadow rating due to increased expenses and the upcoming maturity. The Harbor Court loan is secured by a ground lease on a parcel of land in Honolulu, HI and expires in 2074. A 201,256 sf office/mixed-use building is constructed on the site. The loan is scheduled to mature in May 2014 and maintains an investment grade shadow rating. In 2009, six non defeased loans (10.5%) are scheduled to mature and have a weighted average coupon rate of 4.43% and a servicer reported DSCR of 1.94. In 2010, 21 non defeased loans (15.6%) are scheduled to mature and have a weighted average coupon rate of 4.67% and a servicer reported DSCR of 2.21. Fitch's rating definitions and the terms of use of such ratings are available on the agency's public site, www.fitchratings.com. Published ratings, criteria and methodologies are available from this site, at all times. Fitch's code of conduct, confidentiality, conflicts of interest, affiliate firewall, compliance and other relevant policies and procedures are also available from the 'Code of Conduct' section of this site. Fitch Ratings, New York Michael Chakardjian, 212-908-0846 Adam Fox, 212-908-0869 or Media Relations: Sandro Scenga, 212-908-0278 Email: sandro.scenga@fitchratings.com Copyright Business Wire 2009

entry.headline: Fitch Rates Pfizer's $13.5B Senior Notes 'AA'
entry.body: CHICAGO--(Business Wire)-- Fitch Ratings has assigned an 'AA' rating to Pfizer Inc.'s (Pfizer) proposed public issuance of $13.5 billion of senior unsecured notes, comprising five tranches. The debt offering comprises two-year floating-rate notes, three-year fixed-rate notes, six-year fixed-rate notes, 10-year fixed-rate notes, and 30-year fixed-rate notes. Proceeds from the senior unsecured debt are expected to be used for general corporate purposes and to partially finance the acquisition of Wyeth. Fitch has also placed Pfizer's new notes on Rating Watch Negative, along with the company's other outstanding debt as highlighted below. --Long-term Issuer Default Rating (IDR) 'AA'; --Senior unsecured debt 'AA'; --Bank loan 'AA'; --Short-term IDR 'F1+'; --Commercial paper 'F1+'. Fitch originally placed Pfizer on Rating Watch Negative on Jan. 26, 2009. Pfizer's credit profile will be pressured by the incremental debt used to complete the Wyeth transaction. Fitch will utilize the new information pertaining to the tenure of the new debt and clarification of Pfizer's plans to address the higher leverage in the intermediate term to finalize the rating level. Preliminary calculations using proforma financials, excluding synergies, puts total debt leverage around 1.75 times (x) and net debt leverage at 0.80x at closing, which is expected in the third or fourth quarter. Pfizer stated that annual synergies totaling around $4 billion would be targeted for three years after the completion of the transaction. Additionally, Pfizer will halve its dividend to $0.16 per share, saving over $4 billion of cash annually. Wyeth's product portfolio, strongly centered on biologics and vaccines, does not significantly overlap Pfizer's offerings, increasing the probability of anti-trust clearance of the acquisition. Areas of potential anti-trust concern are the animal health businesses and developmental projects focused on central nervous disorders, specifically Alzheimer's disease. Fitch's rating definitions and the terms of use of such ratings are available on the agency's public site, www.fitchratings.com. Published ratings, criteria and methodologies are available from this site, at all times. Fitch's code of conduct, confidentiality, conflicts of interest, affiliate firewall, compliance and other relevant policies and procedures are also available from the 'Code of Conduct' section of this site. Fitch Ratings, Chicago Michael Zbinovec, 312-368-3164 Bob Kirby, 312-368-3147 or Media Relations: Sandro Scenga, 212-908-0278, New York Email: sandro.scenga@fitchratings.com Copyright Business Wire 2009

entry.headline: iWebTrack Offering Free Accounts to Microsoft adCenter Analytics Customers
entry.body: iWebTrack is Now Offering Free Web Tracking Accounts to Microsoft adCenter Analytics Customers GAINESVILLE, Fla.--(Business Wire)-- iWebTrack Holdings Inc., www.iwebtrack.com, recognizes that Microsoft adCenter Analytics will no longer be operating as of December 31st, 2009 and is responding with a generous offer for their customers. iWebTrack is running a promotion for current Microsoft adCenter Analytics customers in response to the news that Microsoft has decided to close their adCenter Analytics service just three years after acquiring web analytics giant Deepmetrix. iWebTrack is offering free* web tracking accounts for one year to current Microsoft adCenter Analytics customers in need of a hosted web tracking service. iWebTrack understands the frustration that many adCenter customers are feeling as a result of this decision and would like to offer its Enterprise level analytics package for one year to those affected by the closing of this service. Microsoft adCenter Analytics customers can sign up today for a free account at www.iwebtrack.com. iWebTrack has been making news in the web analytics industry for the past few years, and is giving competitors such as ClickTracks, IndexTools, WebTrends, and Google Analytics a run for their money. One of iWebTrack`s most recent announcements was the opening of Open iWeb. Open iWeb, www.openiweb.com, is a community created to help promote the development of unique applications around iWebTrack`s open API such as the iPhone Web Tracking Application. Thanks to Open iWeb, iWebTrack is able to run the iPhone Application Development Competition which is open to the public. Contestants are developing iPhone Web Tracking Applications designed specifically for iWebTrack. Submissions are being accepted through May 1, 2009, and the $5,000 grand prize winner will be announced on May 15th, 2009. Visit www.openiweb.com for detailed contest information. Microsoft adCenter Analytics customers interested in joining iWebTrack and taking advantage of the free offer can sign up at any time at www.iwebtrack.com. For more information on iWebTrack, contact our sales team at sales@iwebtrack.com or visit our site www.iwebtrack.com. *Some restrictions apply iWebTrack Holdings Inc. Erica Columbo, 877-IWEB-TRK (493-2875) Ext. 9 erica@iwebtrack.com Copyright Business Wire 2009

entry.headline: Pfizer sells $13.5 bln debt in 5 parts - IFR
entry.body:
NEW YORK, March 17 (Reuters) - Pfizer Inc (PFE.N), the world's largest drugmaker, sold $13.5 billion of debt in five parts on Tuesday, said IFR.

The sale consisted of $1.25 billion two-year floating rate notes priced at 195 basis points over the three-month London international bank offered rate, said IFR, a Thomson Reuters Service.

It also included $3.5 billion three-year fixed-rate notes priced to yield 305 basis points more than comparable U.S. Treasuries, $3 billion six-year notes yielding 340 basis points over Treasuries, $3.25 billion 10-year notes yielding 325 basis points over Treasuries and $2.5 billion 30-year bonds priced to yield 345 basis points over Treasuries.

Bank of American, Barclays, Citigroup, Goldman Sachs and JP Morgan are the joint lead managers of the deal. Pfizer is raising money to help fund its purchase of Wyeth WYE.N. (Reporting by Pam Niimi; Editing by Diane Craft)
